relation: This program is definitely worth the money. I am happy that I was able to work in the daytime and attend class at night.
In Bellevue there are tons of things to do outside of the mall/dining/shopping/entertainment. There are trails and hikes within 20 minutes of campus.
I did not experience EWU dining.
I did not live in dorms.
I improved my communication skills with my professors. If you're having trouble keeping up with the work, talk to your prof, they are there to help you.
Be prepared for upper division classes, they are much more challenging than the first two years of college.
I attend class on the Bellevue campus. The times are convenient and the classes are intimate. I am very satisfied with my education here.
pageTitle: Eastern Washington University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {246985=You can't miss a football game on our red turf. In 2010, Eastern Washington University was the Big Sky National Champions! There is a ton of other activities to do, but the hubbub surrounds the football field., 165369=the academic staff at ewu are full of life and knowledge and care about the success of students. topics are current and curriculum is in line with what's happening in 2012., 499810=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 138063=I have previously attended EWU from 2003 to 2007. I really enjoyed the small class sizes, the accessibility of the campus, the resources and the classes I took., 448=EWU is good for all types of students! Its really ideal for students that are looking for a university experience without spending a lot of money. If you are looking for one on one help or meeting with your professor Eastern has about 24:1 ratio in most classes so you will never have a problem talking to your professor and setting a meeting time if you need help.}
textBeforeTable: 07/20/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 23 out of 24 people found this review useful. 1 of 122 Latisha from Marysville, WA Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students EWU is great for all types of students. Even though we are small, we have quite a diverse population in both; ethnicity and career paths. Tips for prospective students Just be ready to become apart of the EWU family. The academic advisors are amazing, if you have any questions just give them a call and they can help you out. Bang for the buck I live a bit further away from Cheney, so I have a 40 minute commute. What I love about being a student at EWU is that you are able to ride the city transportation for free anytime you want. I love how clean and easy the bus system is because it saves me a lot of money not having to buy gas for my gas guzzler. Am enjoying being here Since EWU is on the smaller side, you really get the individual attention that one would not be able to get from going to a larger college. I also love how beautiful and manicured the campus is. Also, if you need to get away for a bit, Spokane is only 20 minutes away. Am learning a lot
